episodeTitle: Stop Magellan! Iva-san Unleashes His Secret Attack
description: Luffy and his allies race through Impel Down's upper levels toward freedom. To buy time for the escape, Ivankov and Inazuma make their stand against Warden Magellan in a desperate battle.

openingSong.title: Kaze wo Sagashite
openingSong.artist: Yaguchi Mari and Straw Hat Pirates

events.title: Inazuma's O Kanabashi - Cutting the Stairs
events.description: Inazuma uses their Choki Choki no Mi powers to cut through the stone staircase between Level 3 and Level 2 of Impel Down, creating a massive gap to slow down Magellan's pursuit. The cut sections of the stairs are manipulated like paper.
events.significance: First named technique shown by Inazuma, demonstrating the full creative potential of the Scissors-Scissors Fruit. This buys crucial time for the escaping prisoners.

quotes.text: I'll cut down the stairs! That should buy us some time!
quotes.speaker: Inazuma
quotes.context: Inazuma preparing to use their devil fruit to create a barrier

events.title: Ivankov vs Magellan - The Delaying Battle Begins
events.description: Emporio Ivankov stays behind on Level 3 to face Warden Magellan directly, using Newkama Kenpo techniques to buy time for Luffy and the other prisoners to escape. Ivankov declares this will be their final stand.
events.significance: A desperate sacrifice play by Ivankov, one of the Revolutionary Army's commanders, to ensure Luffy reaches Marineford to save Ace. Shows the depth of Ivankov's commitment to helping Luffy.

quotes.text: Viva Revolution! I'll hold him here!
quotes.speaker: Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov declaring his intention to fight Magellan alone

events.title: Ivankov's Mudage Shori Ken (Hair Removal Fist)
events.description: Ivankov uses a Newkama Kenpo technique called the Hair Removal Fist against Magellan, showcasing the unique and flamboyant fighting style of the Okama/Newkama martial art.
events.significance: Introduces a new named technique in Ivankov's arsenal, demonstrating the diverse and unconventional nature of Newkama Kenpo.

events.title: Ivankov's Mascara Defense Trick
events.description: Ivankov tricks Magellan by pretending to be hurt by poison touching his face, but reveals he was protected by his thick mascara. This demonstrates Ivankov's tactical thinking and willingness to use any advantage, even cosmetics, in battle.
events.significance: Shows Ivankov's clever combat strategy and the creative ways he uses his appearance and accessories in battle. It temporarily fools even the cautious Magellan.

quotes.text: My mascara is so thick, it protected me from your poison!
quotes.speaker: Ivankov
quotes.context: Revealing his trick to Magellan after pretending to be injured

events.title: Magellan's Venom Road
events.description: Magellan uses his Venom Road technique, engulfing himself completely in liquid poison and traveling through one of his Hydra's necks. He uses this to quickly traverse between levels of Impel Down, bypassing the destroyed staircase.
events.significance: Reveals a new application of Magellan's Doku Doku no Mi powers, showing his ability to use poison for mobility as well as combat. This demonstrates why he's such an effective warden of the prison.

events.title: Magellan Defeats Ivankov
events.description: Despite Ivankov's best efforts using Death Wink and Newkama Kenpo techniques, Magellan's overwhelming poison abilities prove too powerful. Ivankov is defeated and severely poisoned by Magellan's Hydra attack.
events.significance: A devastating defeat of one of the Revolutionary Army's top commanders, showing the true power of Magellan as Impel Down's warden. This highlights the desperate situation the escapees are in.

events.title: Inazuma Poisoned Trying to Delay Magellan
events.description: After witnessing Ivankov's defeat, Inazuma attempts to further delay Magellan but is caught and poisoned by the warden. Despite knowing the danger, Inazuma stays true to their mission of helping the escape.
events.significance: Another sacrifice by a Revolutionary Army member for Luffy's sake. Shows the commitment of Dragon's forces to supporting Luffy, even at great personal cost.

events.title: Luffy's Group Reaches Level 1
events.description: Luffy, along with Crocodile, Jinbe, Daz Bonez, and Bentham, successfully reach Level 1 of Impel Down, the final level before escape. They're one step closer to breaking out of the supposedly inescapable prison.
events.significance: Marks significant progress in the prison break, bringing Luffy closer to his goal of escaping to save Ace at Marineford.

events.title: Buggy and Galdino Reunite with Luffy
events.description: Luffy happily reunites with Buggy and Galdino (Mr. 3) on Level 1, expressing relief that they're safe. The former enemies turned unlikely allies continue their chaotic partnership.
events.significance: Reinforces the unusual alliances formed during the Impel Down escape, with former adversaries working together for survival.

quotes.text: Buggy! Mr. 3! You guys are safe!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy expressing happiness at seeing his unlikely allies alive

events.title: Luffy and Allies Defeat the Jailer Beasts
events.description: The Jailer Beasts (Minotaurus, Minorhinoceros, Minokoala, and Minozebra) confront the escapees on Level 1, but Luffy and his powerful allies quickly overwhelm and defeat all four awakened Zoan users.
events.significance: Demonstrates the overwhelming power of Luffy's alliance, including former Warlords Crocodile and Jinbe. The ease of victory shows how much stronger this group is compared to when Luffy first entered Impel Down.

events.title: Sadi Punishes the Jailer Beasts
events.description: Chief Guard Sadi punishes the Jailer Beasts for their failure to prevent the prisoners from escaping Level 4, showcasing her sadistic nature and the strict discipline within Impel Down.
events.significance: Adds character depth to the Impel Down staff and shows the consequences of failure within the prison hierarchy.

events.title: Magellan Confronts Luffy and the Escapees
events.description: Just as victory seems near, Warden Magellan appears before Luffy and the other escapees, having caught up after defeating Ivankov and Inazuma. He manifests his poison Hydra, creating a terrifying final obstacle between the prisoners and freedom.
events.significance: Sets up the climactic confrontation of the Impel Down arc. With Ace's execution imminent, this represents a potential catastrophic failure of the escape attempt.

quotes.text: Viva Revolution! I'll hold him here!
quotes.speaker: Ivankov
quotes.context: Declaring his intention to fight Magellan alone to buy time

quotes.text: My mascara is so thick, it protected me from your poison!
quotes.speaker: Ivankov
quotes.context: Revealing his trick after fooling Magellan

quotes.text: I'll cut down the stairs! That should buy us some time!
quotes.speaker: Inazuma
quotes.context: Preparing to use the Choki Choki no Mi to create a barrier

quotes.text: Buggy! Mr. 3! You guys are safe!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

themes.description: Ivankov and Inazuma willingly sacrifice themselves to give Luffy and the others a chance to escape, demonstrating deep loyalty to Dragon's son and their revolutionary ideals.
themes.symbolism: The Revolutionary Army's commitment to supporting Luffy mirrors the broader themes of inherited will and the next generation carrying forward the dreams of their predecessors.

themes.description: Former enemies like Crocodile, Buggy, and Mr. 3 work together with Luffy toward a common goal, showing how desperate circumstances can forge strange partnerships.
themes.symbolism: The diverse group of escapees represents how people from different backgrounds can unite against oppression and for freedom.

themes.description: Magellan's dominance over even powerful fighters like Ivankov demonstrates the terrifying strength of those who guard the world's most dangerous prison.
themes.symbolism: Magellan represents the seemingly insurmountable power of the World Government's authority and control.

characterSpotlights.development: Ivankov demonstrates the full extent of his loyalty to Dragon and commitment to helping Luffy by facing Magellan in a battle he knows he likely cannot win.
keyActions: Uses Newkama Kenpo techniques including Death Wink
Is defeated and poisoned by Magellan
quotes: Viva Revolution! I'll hold him here!
My mascara is so thick, it protected me from your poison!

characterSpotlights.development: Magellan proves why he is the warden of Impel Down by defeating powerful opponents and relentlessly pursuing the escapees despite all obstacles.
keyActions: Uses Venom Road to bypass destroyed stairs
Confronts Luffy and all the escapees on Level 1

characterSpotlights.development: Inazuma shows their devil fruit abilities and dedication to the Revolutionary Army's mission by using their powers to delay Magellan and aid the escape.
keyActions: Uses Choki Choki no Mi to cut the stairs
Is poisoned while buying time for others
quotes: I'll cut down the stairs! That should buy us some time!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy continues pushing forward toward escape and Marineford, focused on his goal of saving Ace despite the mounting dangers and sacrifices of his allies.
quotes: Buggy! Mr. 3! You guys are safe!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle between Ivankov and Magellan with additional exchanges and techniques compared to the manga.
Additional scenes showing Sadi punishing the Jailer Beasts were added for the anime.

trivia.fact: This episode covers pages 2-17 of Chapter 545, with the chapter being split across three episodes (455, 448, and 449).
The opening song 'Kaze wo Sagashite' is performed by Yaguchi Mari and the Straw Hat Pirates, featuring the voice actors of the crew.
Ivankov's mascara defense trick is an anime-extended scene that adds humor to an otherwise tense battle.
The Jailer Beasts are revealed to be 'awakened' Zoan users by Crocodile, though this was established in previous episodes.
This episode originally aired in Japan on April 25, 2010, during the height of the Impel Down arc's popularity.
